data.actual_result: The first time you press the **X** button, the button actually enables the check mark, rather than opening the modal. And pressing the X button one more time, opens the modal as intended.
data.expected_result: The first time you press the **X** button that would disallow the feature for you, the modal saying *Pretty sure you don't want to do this* should come up and alert you.
data.short_description: Creating a role or member specific permission for a channel that removes your permission to do something in it (i.e creating instant invites) has unintended behavior when pressing the X-button
data.steps_to_repro: - Go to a channel that you have permission to see and do things in (i.e Create Instant Invites but also permissions to manage the channel) - In **Channel Settings** for that channel, press **Permissions**  - Press **Add member** and find your name, press it - Remove a permission node that should result in disallowing the permission node to you as well. - Press the **X** on the permission node one more time.
